original_definition: 'biomass fuel' means a gaseous or liquid fuel produced from biomass;
generated_definition: 'biomass fuel' means biomass fuel is a renewable energy source that is derived from organic matter such as wood, crops, and waste materials, and is used to generate heat and electricity.

Article 2: ‘conventional water heater’ means a water heater that generates heat using the combustion of fossil and/orbiomass fuels and/or the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements;
‘biomass fuel’ means a gaseous or liquid fuel produced from biomass;
‘conventional water heater’ means a water heater that generates heat using the combustion of fossil and/or biomass fuels and/or the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements;
